title: Who Mods the Mods
body: I've got a question that I honestly don't understand, so please don't shut down this thread for "disrespecting or insulting rioters/mods." Who the heck is in charge of moderating the moderators? Is there some sort of hierarchy that keeps mods from doing what ever they like? I'm asking because I've noticed some of the mods are getting heat for shutting down posts or threads for no apparent reason. Also, it seems that the users don't have any say, and are simply left to the mercy of the all powerful moderators. Just asking, let me know if you have any info.

replies.body:
>Who the heck is in charge of moderating the moderators?

 The Moderators themselves are monitored by the Heralds. 

Heralds are less common and _as far as I know_ there are only 5 - Ulanopo, The Djinn, Evangele, KnightsKemplar, and Attysu The Poro. Generally speaking Heralds seem to work on a lot of behind-the-scenes related content like creating [subboard-specific rulesets](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/OjEUxbwH-player-behavior-rules-update) and addressing complaints about staff members or [the Boards themselves,](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation/o1j0fg6g-mods-shouldnt-be-allowed-to-remove-posts-that-protest-mods) they usually don't deal with simple tasks like post removals (or atleast not at the rate at which regular Moderators do.)

 And _I believe_ the Boards Moderation Team (including Heralds, Moderators, Specialists, etc.) are all subject to a general ruleset given to them by Riot, although they're not always under severe moderation from them as the two teams (Riot + BMT) are separate entities. And of course I could be wrong on this point, in which case I'd like a member of staff to come in here and lay the smackdown on me 

Edit: If you want a good explanation of the roles and their duties, check this link:

#**https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation/FJr1kR84-board-update-volunteer-team-community-roles**

This is correct.

Heralds oversee the regular moderators.

And Riot has the power to oversee Heralds and the modteam generally, though there are fine points of distinction there relating to the general volunteer nature of the team.

Riot is pretty hands-off with these boards, though Rioters *very* occasionally step in to help handle the absolute worst cases - which include serial ban evaders and legitimate criminal hackers as well as those making violent threats against the modteam, Riot, et cetera.

----------

What I feel like is more important to address is that there is absolutely a set of recourses and a chain of command for those who feel they have been moderated unfairly.

All Boards users have the right generally speaking to ask for review of their cases, and that almost universally starts with requesting a pullroom session in the official Boards Discord.  That Discord is open to *nearly* everyone, even permabanned Boards accounts, as that is the official mechanism to request case reviews.  EDIT:  However, as Djinn tells me, you can get yourself banned from Discord too if you violate the rules there - so it's best to approach with kindness and courtesy.

You *can* get banned from League and all of its affiliated programs 100% forever if you do *really* bad things - any actionable threats fall under that line, as does serial ban evading, or any kind of hacking, and certainly any criminal behavior not otherwise covered here -  so I do encourage people not to ever try.

For the overwhelming majority of cases however, Discord review is possible and encouraged for those who genuinely feel they have been wronged.

Contrary to a lot of public opinion, we are not power-mad and unreasonable people.   We are just generally speaking people who simply want to help keep the Boards free of bullying and to create a positive space for the game.  And like every person in every environment charged with keeping the peace - we do the best we can, but we're human, so we make mistakes too.  We are frequently overworked, having to resolve dozens of cases in just about every moderation session we undertake, so what may seem like "power-mad" behavior to some is frequently just either omission by exhaustion or very simply our own human failings coming into play - because we *are* human beings too, and not perfect.

Appeals happen fairly frequently, and we always try to be as reasonable as we can in this process.

This is the link for that Discord server, for those interested in starting the process.


https://discord.gg/6JevFSb

This is inaccurate. Board Developer is a volunteer position associated with the Board Moderation Team. Riot does have oversight of the Heralds and the Mods, but it's not the Board Developers who do that.

> Riot is pretty hands-off with these boards...

Riot is fairly hands-off now, but was much more hands on at the start of the program. They come in as needed when needed, but the slight pullback in their day-to-day involvement is due to their confidence in the volunteer team at the current moment.

>The only way to get that right revoked is to join the class of absolute worst-offenders who have made actionable violent threats, used serious hacking software for ban-evades, or other things that genuinely constitute a danger to the community, the modteam, Rioters, Riot, or the game itself.
